Package com.github.tommyettinger.crux

Interface PointN<P extends PointN<P>>

Type Parameters:
P - in implementing types, this is the implementing type
All Known Subinterfaces:
Point2<P>, Point3<P>, Point4<P>, Point5<P>, Point6<P>
public interface PointN<P extends PointN<P>>
A minimal super-interface that can be implemented by (subclasses of) both com.badlogic.gdx.math.GridPoint2 and com.badlogic.gdx.math.Vector2, as well as their 3D (or higher) counterparts.

  • Method Details

    • rank

      int rank()
      Gets how many components this type of point has; typically 2 (for points with x and y) or 3 (for points with x, y, and z). This could also be called the dimensionality.
      Returns:
      how many components this type of point has

    • floatingPoint

      boolean floatingPoint()
      Returns true if this type of point uses float or double for its components, or false otherwise.
      Returns:
      true if this point can use float values for its components

    • mutable

      default boolean mutable()
      Returns true if this type of point is mutable and can be edited in-place. If this is false, then the type can either allocate another point when a modified version is needed, or pull one out of an existing pool (in some cases where this makes sense).
      This is a default method that returns true unless overridden. Most types can leave this alone.
      Returns:
      true if this type is mutable, or false otherwise.

    • cpy

      P cpy()
      Returns a copy of this point, or if this type is immutable, this same point.
      Returns:
      a copy of this point, if it is mutable, or this point as-is, if it is immutable

    • len

      default float len()

    • len2

      float len2()

    • set

      P set(P point)
      Returns a point that holds the same contents as the point parameter. For mutable types, this should edit this value in-place. For immutable types, it must return a new value.
      Parameters:
      point - another point of the same type; will not be modified
      Returns:
      if this is mutable, then this value after editing; if this is immutable, then a different edited point

    • setZero

      P setZero()
      Returns a point that holds 0 for all components. For mutable types, this should edit this value in-place. For immutable types, it must return a new value.
      Returns:
      if this is mutable, then this value after editing; if this is immutable, then a different edited point

    • sub

      P sub(P point)
      Subtracts the components in point from those in this, and returns a point with the subtracted values. For mutable points, this changes the value in-place, and for immutable points, it returns a different point.
      Parameters:
      point - another point of the same type; will not be modified
      Returns:
      if this is mutable, then this value after editing; if this is immutable, then a different edited point

    • add

      P add(P point)
      Adds the components in point to those in this, and returns a point with the added values. For mutable points, this changes the value in-place, and for immutable points, it returns a different point.
      Parameters:
      point - another point of the same type; will not be modified
      Returns:
      if this is mutable, then this value after editing; if this is immutable, then a different edited point

    • scl

      P scl(P point)
      Multiplies the components in point with those in this, and returns a point with the multiplied values. For mutable points, this changes the value in-place, and for immutable points, it returns a different point.
      Parameters:
      point - another point of the same type; will not be modified
      Returns:
      if this is mutable, then this value after editing; if this is immutable, then a different edited point

    • sub

      P sub(float scalar)
      Subtracts scalar from the components in this, and returns a point with the subtracted values. For mutable points, this changes the value in-place, and for immutable points, it returns a different point.
      Parameters:
      scalar - a single float to subtract from each component in this
      Returns:
      if this is mutable, then this value after editing; if this is immutable, then a different edited point

    • add

      P add(float scalar)
      Adds scalar to the components in this, and returns a point with the added values. For mutable points, this changes the value in-place, and for immutable points, it returns a different point.
      Parameters:
      scalar - a single float to add to each component in this
      Returns:
      if this is mutable, then this value after editing; if this is immutable, then a different edited point

    • scl

      P scl(float scalar)
      Multiplies scalar with each component in this, and returns a point with the multiplied values. For mutable points, this changes the value in-place, and for immutable points, it returns a different point.
      Parameters:
      scalar - a single float to multiply with each component in this
      Returns:
      if this is mutable, then this value after editing; if this is immutable, then a different edited point

    • dst

      default float dst(P point)
      Gets the distance from this point to the parameter point, using Euclidean distance, as a float.
      Parameters:
      point - another point of the same type; will not be modified
      Returns:
      the distance from this point to the parameter, using Euclidean distance, as a float

    • dst2

      float dst2(P point)
      Gets the distance from this point to the parameter point, using squared Euclidean distance, as a float. Note that because this is squared, it is an inadmissible metric for some purposes, such as A* heuristics.
      Parameters:
      point - another point of the same type; will not be modified
      Returns:
      the distance from this point to the parameter, using squared Euclidean distance, as a float

    • nor

      default P nor()
      Normalizes this point in-place, making its length as close to 1.0 as this can get. This only really makes sense for float components (where floatingPoint() is true).
      Returns:
      this point after modifications, if possible, or a new edited point if this is immutable

    • isUnit

      default boolean isUnit()
      Returns true if the squared distance from the origin to this point is 1 (within floating-point error of 0.000001f).
      Returns:
      true if this point has squared distance 1 from the origin, within a tolerance of 0.000001f

    • isUnit

      default boolean isUnit(float tolerance)
      Returns true if the squared distance from the origin to this point is 1 (within the given tolerance up or down).
      Parameters:
      tolerance - how much floating-point error to tolerate and still treat this as equal to 1
      Returns:
      true if this point has squared distance 1 from the origin, within the given tolerance

    • isZero

      default boolean isZero()
      Returns true if the squared distance from the origin to this point is 0 (within floating-point error of 0.000001f).
      Returns:
      true if this point has squared distance 0 from the origin, within a tolerance of 0.000001f

    • isZero

      default boolean isZero(float tolerance)
      Returns true if the squared distance from the origin to this point is 0 (within the given tolerance up or down).
      Parameters:
      tolerance - how much floating-point error to tolerate and still treat this as equal to 0
      Returns:
      true if this point has squared distance 0 from the origin, within the given tolerance
